step1.sentence: Her bright red jacket made her stand out in the crowd of grey coats.

step2.story: Among the hundreds of job applications, only a handful stood out to the hiring team. The ones that did shared one thing: they told a specific, honest story about the applicant.

step3.story: At the science fair, most of the displays followed the expected format with neat boards and printed graphs. One project stood out immediately: a student had built a working model of a water filter using only materials found in her backyard. It was messy and imperfect, but it actually worked. The judges spent the longest time at her table.

meaning.realUsageKo: 다른 사람이나 사물보다 뚜렷하게 눈에 띄거나 특별히 인상적일 때 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: stand(서다)와 out(밖으로, 두드러지게)이 결합하여 다른 것들 사이에서 밖으로 튀어나와 보인다는 의미가 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 외모, 능력, 작품 등이 다른 것들 사이에서 특별히 눈에 띌 때 씁니다. 긍정적 뉘앙스가 강합니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Her performance really stood out compared to the other candidates.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그녀의 발표는 다른 지원자들에 비해 정말 두드러졌어요.
